pullRequest.body:
`MvPowerSeries.coeff_pow` computes the coefficients of powers of power series

`coeff_eq_zero_of_constantCoeff_nilpotent` shows that some coefficients of some powers of a power series are zero when the constant coefficient is nilpotent

CoAuthored with Mar√≠a In√©s de Frutos Fern√°ndez

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #14875

### PR summary [48d2f355dc](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14865/commits/48d2f355dc3bf68f32951f8d99ecd4240889ff3c)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPowerSeries.Basic | 972 | 973 | +1 (+0.10%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>16 files</summary> `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.HurwitzZetaValues` `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.WellKnown` `Mathlib.RingTheory.LaurentSeries` `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Derivative` `Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPowerSeries.Inverse` `Mathlib.RingTheory.HahnSeries.PowerSeries` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.ZetaValues` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.BernoulliPolynomials` `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Order` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.Bernoulli` `Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPowerSeries.Trunc` `Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPowerSeries.Basic` `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Trunc` `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Basic` `Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPowerSeries.NoZeroDivisors` `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Inverse`</details>|1|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ coeff_eq_zero_of_constantCoeff_nilpotent`
`+ coeff_pow`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

> Do we alredy have in mathlib the same result (a polynomial is nilpotent iff all its coefficients are)? And what about the fact that a polynomial is a unit iff the constant coefficient is and all the other coefficients are nilpotent?

I am pretty sure we don't have the result for nilpotent poly (I kept it as a small project for students, but maybe it's time to do it). We have the characterization of units and zero-divisors though (done by students of mine :D)

Regarding nilpotent/zero divisors power series : they are studied in the same paper by Fields. 
It would be nice to formalize them, but for zero divisors one needs the primary decomposition and the hypothesis that the ring is noetherian.
I think I did all changes you suggested, but I don't understand why github still marks "1 requested change"

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14875~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

@AntoineChambert-Loir I think the "1 changes requested" measures the number of reviewers that have "requested changes" using this github feature. And only that reviewer can remove the "requested changes" when they indicate they are happy.
But `bors` doesn't care, so this metric isn't formally blocking anything.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10052913427/job/27784856785)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10052913427/job/27784857129)

Do we alredy have in mathlib the same result (a polynomial is nilpotent iff all its coefficients are)? And what about the fact that a polynomial is a unit iff the constant coefficient is and all the other coefficients are nilpotent?

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Thanks! Some comments below, but I have not finished looking at the proof of `coeff_eq_zero_of_constantCoeff_nilpotent` yet.

Do we alredy have in mathlib the same result (a polynomial is nilpotent iff all its coefficients are)? And what about the fact that a polynomial is a unit iff the constant coefficient is and all the other coefficients are nilpotent?

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
[N. Bourbaki, *Algebra. {II}. {C}hapters 4--7*, Chap. 4, ¬ß4, n¬∞2, proposition 3][bourbaki1981] -/
```

```suggestion
theorem coeff_pow [DecidableEq œÉ] (f : MvPowerSeries œÉ R) {n : ‚Ñï} (d : œÉ ‚Üí‚ÇÄ ‚Ñï) :
```
What is `s`?
nothing‚Ä¶

```suggestion
  suffices f ^ n = (Finset.range n).prod fun _ ‚Ü¶ f by
```

```suggestion
/-- The degree of a monomial. -/
```
Can we make it `simp`?
yes

```suggestion
  constructor <;>
  intro hd
  ¬∑ ext x
    simp only [Finsupp.coe_zero, Pi.zero_apply, ‚Üê Nat.lt_one_iff, ‚Üê not_le]
    intro hx
    apply Nat.not_add_one_le_zero 0
    rw [zero_add, ‚Üê hd]
    exact hx.trans 
      <| single_le_sum (fun _ _ ‚Ü¶ zero_le _) (mem_support_iff.mpr <| Nat.not_eq_zero_of_lt hx)
  ¬∑ simp only [hd, degree_zero]
```
Can you add some of these new results in the preamble of the file?
I can, but the preamble has no results at all, so this would look a bit awkward.

```suggestion
    {f : MvPowerSeries œÉ R} {m : ‚Ñï} (hf : constantCoeff œÉ R f ^ m = 0)
    (d : œÉ ‚Üí‚ÇÄ ‚Ñï) {n : ‚Ñï} (hn : m + degree d ‚â§ n) :
```
I do not think that `d` could be inferred automatically from `hn`, but if yes it could be turned implicit as well.
OK.

```suggestion
  set s := (range n).filter fun i ‚Ü¶ k i = 0 with hs_def
```

```suggestion
  have hs' (i : ‚Ñï) (hi : i ‚àà s) : coeff R (k i) f = constantCoeff œÉ R f := by
```

```suggestion
    {d : œÉ ‚Üí‚ÇÄ ‚Ñï} {n : ‚Ñï} (hn : m + degree d ‚â§ n) : coeff R d (f ^ n) = 0 := by
```

```suggestion
  have hs'' (i : ‚Ñï) (hi : i ‚àà s) : k i = 0 := by
```

```suggestion
```
Upon replacing the `rw` below with `rw [‚Üê prod_sdiff (s‚ÇÅ := s) (filter_subset _ _)]` (which I suggest) this line can be removed, it is used only once.
We use it 3 or 4 times‚Ä¶
but that works.

```suggestion
  rw [‚Üê prod_sdiff (s‚ÇÅ := s) (filter_subset _ _)]
```

```suggestion
  rw [‚Üê Nat.add_le_add_iff_right, add_comm s.card, Finset.card_sdiff_add_card_eq_card hs, card_range]
```

```suggestion
  simp only [add_comm m, Nat.add_le_add_iff_right, ‚Üê hk.1, ‚Üê sum_sdiff hs, 
    sum_eq_zero (s := s) hs'', add_zero]
```

I agree that there is nothing in the premble, but I find it a pity. Since you went through the whole file, adding something there would be valuable (both about things you are adding in this PR and about other interesting results that currently do not appear). I believe the general doc of mathlib is in a poor state and I find it a good idea to improve it little by little as file are improved/refactored.
I agree with you on principle, but I am leaving to vacation tomorrow morning‚Ä¶

This is literally [MvPolynomial.degree](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/MvPolynomial/Homogeneous.html#MvPolynomial.degree) isn't it? Note that even if it is the `MvPolynomial` it is really about `finsupp`. We should really avoid duplicating the API here.
I did that already, in another PR!
Can you make this PR dependent on the other one?
Done.

Indeed `exact MvPolynomial.degree_eq_zero_iff _` proves this (after importing it). The really good thing to do would be to extract all this results to a new file, but if everything you need already exists in the `MvPolynomial` you can just use it.
See above.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(MvPowerSeries.Basic): compute coefficients of powers of MvPowerSeries
